intro: Adenopetalum sphaerorhizum, commonly known as the globe-root or globular root plant, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and Africa. It is characterized by its distinctive, rounded tuberous roots and clusters of small, white or pinkish flowers. The plant belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along riverbanks. Its unique root structure and ornamental flowers make it a subject of interest in both botanical studies and horticulture.
